tomato.consensus: Mr. Nobody's narrative tangles may bedevil as much as they entertain, but its big ambitions and absorbing visuals make for an intriguing addition to director Jaco Van Dormael's filmography.

tomato.consensus: What makes Dan Brown's novel a best seller is evidently not present in this dull and bloated movie adaptation of The Da Vinci Code.

tomato.consensus: Saw II is likely to please the gore-happy fans of the original, though it may be too gruesome for those not familiar with first film's premise.

tomato.consensus: In terms of quality, Dr. T and the Women is one of Altman's good-but-not-great films. In typical Altman style, it features some great ensemble acting, including a wonderful performance by Richard Gere.

details.title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi
details.plot: After rescuing Han Solo from the palace of Jabba the Hutt, the rebels attempt to destroy the second Death Star, while Luke struggles to make Vader return from the dark side of the Force.

tomato.consensus: Though failing to reach the cinematic heights of its predecessors, Return of the Jedi remains an entertaining sci-fi adventure and a fitting end to the classic trilogy.

awards.text: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 15 wins & 15 nominations.

title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi

details.title: Star Trek Into Darkness
details.plot: After the crew of the Enterprise find an unstoppable force of terror from within their own organization, Captain Kirk leads a manhunt to a war-zone world to capture a one-man weapon of mass destruction.

tomato.consensus: Visually spectacular and suitably action packed, Star Trek Into Darkness is a rock-solid installment in the venerable sci-fi franchise, even if it's not as fresh as its predecessor.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 6 wins & 44 nominations.

details.title: I Love You, Man
details.plot: Friendless Peter Klaven goes on a series of man-dates to find a Best Man for his wedding. But, when his insta-bond with his new B.F.F. puts a strain on his relationship with his fiancée, can the trio learn to live happily ever after?

tomato.consensus: I Love You, Man makes the most of its simple premise due to the heartfelt and hilarious performances of Paul Rudd and Jason Segel.

details.title: From Russia with Love
details.plot: James Bond willingly falls into an assassination ploy involving a naive Russian beauty in order to retrieve a Soviet encryption device that was stolen by SPECTRE.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 2 wins & 5 nominations.

details.title: Space Cowboys
details.plot: When a retired engineer is called upon to rescue a failing satellite, he insists that his equally old teammates accompany him into space.

tomato.consensus: While the plot is overly cliched, the suberb acting by the stars (especially the tense interactions between Clint Eastwood and Tommy Lee Jones) and the spectacular special effects make this a movie worth seeing.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 6 nominations.

details.title: Turks in Space
details.plot: A family of Turks try to adapt to life in a new solar system.

details.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
details.plot: Two drag queens and a transsexual travel across the desert to perform their unique style of cabaret.

tomato.consensus: While its premise is ripe for comedy -- and it certainly delivers its fair share of laughs -- Priscilla is also a surprisingly tender and thoughtful road movie with some outstanding performances.

title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert

details.title: The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle
details.plot: When enemies Boris, Natasha and Fearless leader escape into the real world with a nefarious scheme, Rocky & Bullwinkle do the same and team up with a young F.B.I. agent to stop the trio.

tomato.consensus: Though the film stays true to the nature of the original cartoon, the script is disappointing and not funny.

details.title: Best in Show
details.plot: A colorful array of characters competes at a national dog show.

tomato.consensus: A fine example of writer-director-star Christopher Guest's gift for improv comedy, Best in Show boasts an appealingly quirky premise and a brilliantly talented cast.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 11 wins & 13 nominations.

details.title: Show Boat
details.plot: The daughter of a riverboat captain falls in love with a charming gambler, but their fairytale romance is threatened when his luck turns sour.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 1 win & 2 nominations.

details.title: Dawn of the Dead
details.plot: A nurse, a policeman, a young married couple, a salesman, and other survivors of a worldwide plague that is producing aggressive, flesh-eating zombies, take refuge in a mega Midwestern shopping mall.

tomato.consensus: A kinetic, violent and surprisingly worthy remake of George Romero's horror classic that pays homage to the original while working on its own terms.

details.title: Night of the Living Dead
details.plot: A group of people hide from bloodthirsty zombies in a farmhouse.

details.title: Planet Terror
details.plot: After an experimental bio-weapon is released, turning thousands into zombie-like creatures, it's up to a rag-tag group of survivors to stop the infected and those behind its release.

details.title: Forbidden Planet
details.plot: A starship crew goes to investigate the silence of a planet's colony only to find two survivors and a deadly secret that one of them has.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 1 win & 1 nomination.

details.title: Alien: Resurrection
details.plot: Two centuries after her death, Ellen Ripley is revived as a powerful human/alien hybrid clone who must continue her war against the aliens.

details.title: Alien Abduction
details.plot: A vacationing family encounters an alien threat in this thriller based on the real-life Brown Mountain Lights phenomenon in North Carolina.

details.title: The Heartbreak Kid
details.plot: A newly wed man who believes he's just gotten hitched to the perfect woman encounters another lady on his honeymoon.

tomato.consensus: Despite some amiable performances, The Heartbreak Kid is neither as daring nor as funny as the Farrelly Brothers' earlier films.

details.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
details.plot: The adventures of a teenager who is fresh out and in Middle School, where he has to learn the consequences and responsibility to survive the year.

tomato.consensus: Unlike its bestselling source material, Diary of a Wimpy Kid fails to place a likable protagonist at the center of its middle-school humor -- and its underlying message is drowned out as a result.

details.title: Honey I Blew Up the Kid
details.plot: The Szalinski family is back, this time hilarious disaster strikes when an experiment causes their new toddler son to grow many stories tall.

title: Honey I Blew Up the Kid

details.title: Sukiyaki Western Django
details.plot: A revolver-wielding stranger crosses paths with two warring clans who are both on the hunt for a hidden treasure in a remote western town. Knowing his services are valuable to either side, he offers himself to the clan who will offer up the largest share of the wealth.

tomato.consensus: Inventive and off-kilter, the newest feast from J-Horror director Takashi Miike is super-sensory, self-referential and somewhat excessive.

details.title: Total western
details.plot: After a drug deal gone wrong, Bédé goes into hiding in the countryside at a reformative school for criminal youth. His location is found out, and he and the pupils have to protect themselves with whatever means they have.

details.plot: When Edward Creighton leads the construction of the Western Union to unite East with West, he hires a Western reformed outlaw and a tenderfoot Eastern surveyor.

details.plot: When a beautiful socialite masquerades as a maid, she becomes involved with an unpretentious, plain-spoken cowboy who's unaware of her true identity.

details.plot: Two peanut vendors at a rodeo show get in trouble with their boss and hide out on a railroad train heading west. They get jobs as cowboys on a dude ranch, despite the fact that neither of ...

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 3 wins & 2 nominations.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 15 wins & 8 nominations.

details.title: Leatherface: Texas Chainsaw Massacre III
details.plot: A California couple and a survivalist encounter the cannibal family.

details.title: My Awkward Sexual Adventure
details.plot: To win back his ex-girlfriend, a conservative accountant enlists the help of an exotic dancer to guide him on a quest for sexual experience, leading him into a world of strip clubs, sensual massage parlors, cross-dressing and S & M.

details.title: Arthur and the Great Adventure
details.plot: Arthur answers a distress call from Princess Selenia, who is menaced by the nefarious Maltazard.

details.title: Where the Wild Things Are
details.plot: Yearning for escape and adventure, a young boy runs away from home and sails to an island filled with creatures that take him in as their king.

tomato.consensus: Some may find its dark tone and slender narrative off-putting, but Spike Jonze's heartfelt adaptation of the classic children's book is as beautiful as it is uncompromising.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 7 wins & 44 nominations.

details.title: Wild Strawberries
details.plot: After living a life marked by coldness, an aging professor is forced to confront the emptiness of his existence.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 12 wins & 2 nominations.

details.title: Son in Law
details.plot: Having gotten a taste of college life, a drastically changed farm girl returns home for Thanksgiving break with her best friend, a flamboyant party animal who is clearly a fish out of water in a small farm town.

details.plot: A drama about the Algerian struggle for independence from France after WWII.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 3 nominations.

details.title: Bound
details.plot: Corky, a tough female ex con and her lover Violet concoct a scheme to steal millions of stashed mob money and pin the blame on Violet's crooked boyfriend Caesar.

details.title: Shutter Island
details.plot: A U.S Marshal investigates the disappearance of a murderess who escaped from a hospital for the criminally insane.

tomato.consensus: It may not rank with Scorsese's best work, but Shutter Island's gleefully unapologetic genre thrills represent the director at his most unrestrained.

details.title: City Island
details.plot: The Rizzos, a family who doesn't share their habits, aspirations, and careers with one another, find their delicate web of lies disturbed by the arrival of a young ex-con (Strait) brought ...

tomato.consensus: Raymond De Felitta combines warmth, humanity, and a natural sense of humor, and is abetted by Andy Garcia and an excellent ensemble cast.

details.title: After Earth
details.plot: A crash landing leaves Kitai Raige and his father Cypher stranded on Earth, a millennium after events forced humanity's escape. With Cypher injured, Kitai must embark on a perilous journey to signal for help.

tomato.consensus: After Earth is a dull, ploddingly paced exercise in sentimental sci-fi -- and the latest setback for director M. Night Shyamalan's once-promising career.

details.title: Another Earth
details.plot: On the night of the discovery of a duplicate Earth in the Solar system, an ambitious young student and an accomplished composer cross paths in a tragic accident.

details.title: Pretty Woman
details.plot: A man in a legal but hurtful business needs an escort for some social events, and hires a beautiful prostitute he meets... only to fall in love.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 8 wins & 10 nominations.

details.title: Woman in Gold
details.plot: Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family.

tomato.consensus: Woman in Gold benefits from its talented leads, but strong work from Helen Mirren and Ryan Reynolds isn't enough to overpower a disappointingly dull treatment of a fascinating true story.

details.title: I Could Never Be Your Woman
details.plot: A mother falls for a younger man while her daughter falls in love for the first time. Mother Nature messes with their fates.

title: I Could Never Be Your Woman

details.title: The Lost Boys
details.plot: After moving to a new town, two brothers discover that the area is a haven for vampires.

tomato.consensus: Flawed but eminently watchable, Joel Schumacher's teen vampire thriller blends horror, humor, and plenty of visual style with standout performances from a cast full of young 1980s stars.

details.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
details.plot: Archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones is hired by the US government to find the Ark of the Covenant before the Nazis.

tomato.consensus: Featuring bravura set pieces, sly humor, and white-knuckle action, Raiders of the Lost Ark is one of the most consummately entertaining adventure pictures of all time.

details.title: A Little Romance
details.plot: A French boy (Daniel) and an American girl (Lauren), who goes to school in Paris, meet and begin a little romance. They befriend Julius who enchants them with his storytelling. In an ...

details.title: Tillie's Punctured Romance
details.plot: Charlie talks wealthy farmer's daughter Tillie into eloping with him (and taking her father's money). In the city Tillie gets drunk and lands in jail while Charlie runs off with her money ...

details.title: Little Nicky
details.plot: After two of the devil's three sons escape Hell to wreak havoc on Earth, the devil must send his third son, the mild-mannered Nicky, to bring them back before it's too late.

tomato.consensus: Despite the presence of a large, talented cast, the jokes in Little Nicky are dumb, tasteless, and not that funny, and Adam Sandler's character is grating to watch.

details.title: Angel Heart
details.plot: Harry Angel is a private investigator. He is hired by a man who calls himself Louis Cyphre to track down a singer called Johnny Favorite. But the investigation takes an unexpected and somber turn.

details.title: A Mighty Heart
details.plot: Mariane Pearl embarks on a frantic search to locate her journalist husband, Daniel, when he goes missing in Pakistan.

tomato.consensus: Angelina Jolie conveys the full emotional range of a woman in a desperate situation in A Mighty Heart, an urgent yet tactful film about a difficult subject.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 4 wins & 17 nominations.

details.title: Big Fish
details.plot: A son tries to learn more about his dying father by reliving stories and myths he told about his life.

tomato.consensus: A charming father-and-son tale filled with typical Tim Burton flourishes.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 1 win & 46 nominations.

details.title: Big
details.plot: When a boy wishes to be big at a magic wish machine, he wakes up the next morning and finds himself in an adult body.

tomato.consensus: Refreshingly sweet and undeniably funny, Big is a showcase for Tom Hanks, who dives into his role and infuses it with charm and surprising poignancy.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 11 wins & 12 nominations.

details.title: Once Upon a Time in America
details.plot: A former Prohibition-era Jewish gangster returns to the Lower East Side of Manhattan over thirty years later, where he once again must confront the ghosts and regrets of his old life.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 11 wins & 7 nominations.

title: Once Upon a Time in America

details.title: A Time to Kill
details.plot: A young lawyer defends a black man accused of murdering two men who raped his 10-year-old daughter, sparking a rebirth of the K.K.K.

tomato.consensus: Overlong and superficial, A Time to Kill nonetheless succeeds on the strength of its skillful craftsmanship and top-notch performances.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 7 wins & 10 nominations.

details.title: L.A. Story
details.plot: With the help of a talking freeway billboard, a "wacky weatherman" tries to win the heart of an English newspaper reporter, who is struggling to make sense of the strange world of early-90s Los Angeles.

details.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
details.plot: A journalist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing -- or dead -- for forty years by a young female hacker.

tomato.consensus: Its graphic violence and sprawling length will prove too much for some viewers to take, but Noomi Rapace's gripping performance makes The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo an unforgettable viewing experience.

awards.text: Won 2 BAFTA Film Awards. Another 17 wins & 34 nominations.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

details.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
details.plot: A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works.

tomato.consensus: Visually arresting, but the story could be told with a bit more energy.

awards.text: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 17 wins & 41 nominations.

details.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
details.plot: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her young son, John Connor, from a more advanced cyborg, made out of liquid metal.

tomato.consensus: T2 features thrilling action sequences and eye-popping visual effects, but what takes this sci-fi/ action landmark to the next level is the depth of the human (and cyborg) characters.

details.title: A Good Day to Die Hard
details.plot: John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working undercover, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces.

tomato.consensus: A Good Day to Die Hard is the weakest entry in a storied franchise, and not even Bruce Willis' smirking demeanor can enliven a cliched, uninspired script.

title: A Good Day to Die Hard

details.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
details.plot: Scott Pilgrim must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes in order to win her heart.

tomato.consensus: Its script may not be as dazzling as its eye-popping visuals, but Scott Pilgrim vs. the World is fast, funny, and inventive.

details.title: Ghost World
details.plot: With only the plan of moving in together after high school, two unusually devious friends seek direction in life. As a mere gag, they respond to a man's newspaper ad for a date, only to find it will greatly complicate their lives.

tomato.consensus: With acerbic wit, Terry Zwigoff fashions Daniel Clowes' graphic novel into an intelligent, comedic trip through deadpan teen angst.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 26 wins & 53 nominations.

details.title: Iron Man
details.plot: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, an industrialist creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

tomato.consensus: Director Jon Favreau and star Robert Downey Jr. make this smart, high impact superhero movie one that even non-comics fans can enjoy.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 19 wins & 58 nominations.

details.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
details.plot: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to solve the mystery of his parent's mysterious death.

tomato.consensus: A well-chosen cast and sure-handed direction allow The Amazing Spider-Man to thrill, despite revisiting many of the same plot points from 2002's Spider-Man.

details.title: Toy Story
details.plot: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's room.

tomato.consensus: Entertaining as it is innovative, Toy Story reinvigorated animation while heralding the arrival of Pixar as a family-friendly force to be reckoned with.

awards.text: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 22 wins & 17 nominations.

details.title: Perfume: The Story of a Murderer
details.plot: Jean-Baptiste Grenouille, born with a superior olfactory sense, creates the world's finest perfume. His work, however, takes a dark turn as he searches for the ultimate scent.

tomato.consensus: Perfume is what you'd expect from a Tom Twyker-directed movie glamorizing a serial killer: a kinetic visual feast, with a dark antihero that's impossible to feel sympathy for.

title: Perfume: The Story of a Murderer

details.title: Life of Pi
details.plot: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

tomato.consensus: A 3D adaptation of a supposedly "unfilmable" book, Ang Lee's Life of Pi achieves the near impossible -- it's an astonishing technical achievement that's also emotionally rewarding.

details.title: Good Night, and Good Luck.
details.plot: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy.

tomato.consensus: A passionate and concise cinematic civics lesson, Good Night, And Good Luck has plenty to say about today's political and cultural climate, and its ensemble cast is stellar.

awards.text: Nominated for 6 Oscars. Another 37 wins & 110 nominations.

details.title: Into the Wild
details.plot: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

tomato.consensus: With his sturdy cast and confident direction, Sean Penn has turned a complex work of non-fiction like Into the Wild into an accessible and poignant character study.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 23 wins & 90 nominations.

details.title: The Time Machine
details.plot: Hoping to alter the events of the past, a 19th century inventor instead travels 800,000 years into the future, where he finds humankind divided into two warring races.

tomato.consensus: This Machine has all the razzle-dazzles of modern special effects, but the movie takes a turn for the worst when it switches from a story about lost love to a confusing action-thriller.

details.title: The Girl Next Door
details.plot: A teenager's dreams come true when a former porn star moves in next door and they fall in love.

tomato.consensus: The movie borrows heavily from Risky Business, though Hirsch and Cuthbert are appealing leads.

details.title: Girl, Interrupted
details.plot: Based on writer Susanna Kaysen's account of her 18-month stay at a mental hospital in the 1960s.

tomato.consensus: Angelina Jolie gives an intense performance, but overall Girl, Interrupted suffers from thin, predictable plotting that fails to capture the power of its source material.

details.title: Training Day
details.plot: On his first day on the job as a Los Angeles narcotics officer, a rookie cop goes on a 24-hour training course with a rogue detective who isn't what he appears.

tomato.consensus: The ending may be less than satisfying, but Denzel Washington reminds us why he's such a great actor in this taut and brutal police drama.

details.title: Knight and Day
details.plot: A young woman gets mixed up with a disgraced spy who is trying to clear his name.

tomato.consensus: It's pure formula, but thanks to its breezy pace and a pair of charming performances from Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz, Knight and Day offers some agreeably middle-of-the-road summer action.

details.title: Jurassic World
details.plot: A new theme park is built on the original site of Jurassic Park. Everything is going well until the park's newest attraction--a genetically modified giant stealth killing machine--escapes containment and goes on a killing spree.

tomato.consensus: Jurassic World can't match the original for sheer inventiveness and impact, but it works in its own right as an entertaining -- and visually dazzling -- popcorn thriller.

details.title: Scent of a Woman
details.plot: A prep school student needing money agrees to "babysit" a blind man, but the job is not at all what he anticipated.

tomato.consensus: It might soar on Al Pacino's performance more than the drama itself, but what a performance it is -- big, bold, occasionally over-the-top, and finally giving the Academy pause to award the star his first Oscar.

details.title: Night at the Museum
details.plot: A newly recruited night security guard at the Museum of Natural History discovers that an ancient curse causes the animals and exhibits on display to come to life and wreak havoc.

tomato.consensus: Parents might call this either a spectacle-filled adventure or a shallow and vapid CG-fest, depending on whether they choose to embrace this on the same level as their kids.

details.title: The Night of the Hunter
details.director: Charles Laughton, Robert Mitchum, Terry Sanders
details.plot: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid $10,000 he'd stolen in a robbery.

tomato.consensus: Featuring Robert Mitchum's formidable performance as child-hunting preacher, The Night of the Hunter is a disturbing look at good and evil.

details.title: Run All Night
details.plot: Mobster and hit man Jimmy Conlon has one night to figure out where his loyalties lie: with his estranged son, Mike, whose life is in danger, or his longtime best friend, mob boss Shawn Maguire, who wants Mike to pay for the death of his own son.

tomato.consensus: Liam Neeson is in typically fine form, but Run All Night suffers from a convoluted plot and workmanlike execution.

details.title: Toy Story 3
details.plot: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

tomato.consensus: Deftly blending comedy, adventure, and honest emotion, Toy Story 3 is a rare second sequel that really works.

details.title: It's Kind of a Funny Story
details.plot: A clinically depressed teenager gets a new start after he checks himself into an adult psychiatric ward.

tomato.consensus: It's amiable, and it does a surprisingly good job of sidestepping psych ward comedy cliches, but given its talented cast and directors, It's Kind of a Funny Story should be more than just mildly entertaining.

title: It's Kind of a Funny Story

details.title: Life Is Beautiful
details.plot: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

tomato.consensus: Benigni's earnest charm, when not overstepping its bounds into the unnecessarily treacly, offers the possibility of hope in the face of unflinching horror.

details.plot: After the rebels have been brutally overpowered by the Empire on their newly established base, Luke Skywalker takes advanced Jedi training with Master Yoda, while his friends are pursued by Darth Vader as part of his plan to capture Luke.

tomato.consensus: Dark, sinister, but ultimately even more involving than A New Hope, The Empire Strikes Back defies viewer expectations and takes the series to heightened emotional levels.

title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back

details.title: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones
details.plot: Ten years after initially meeting, Anakin Skywalker shares a forbidden romance with Padmé, while Obi-Wan investigates an assassination attempt on the Senator and discovers a secret clone army crafted for the Jedi.

tomato.consensus: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones benefits from an increased emphasis on thrilling action, although they're once again undercut by ponderous plot points and underdeveloped characters.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 13 wins & 47 nominations.

title: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones

details.title: Shakespeare in Love
details.plot: A young Shakespeare, out of ideas and short of cash, meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays.

tomato.consensus: Endlessly witty, visually rapturous, and sweetly romantic, Shakespeare in Love is a delightful romantic comedy that succeeds on nearly every level.

details.title: From Paris with Love
details.plot: In Paris, a young employee in the office of the US Ambassador hooks up with an American spy looking to stop a terrorist attack in the city.

tomato.consensus: Thought not without its charms -- chief among them John Travolta's endearingly over-the-top performance -- From Paris with Love is too muddled and disjointed to satisfy.

details.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure
details.plot: Two young brothers are drawn into an intergalactic adventure when their house is hurled through the depths of space by the magical board game they are playing.

tomato.consensus: Dazzling special effects for the kids + well-crafted storytelling for the 'rents = cinematic satisfaction for the whole family.

details.title: Huang jia shi jie zhi III: Ci xiong da dao
details.plot: Genji Nakamura and his soul-mate and partner Michiko Nishiwaki are thieves for the notorious Red Army terrorist organization in Japan. After pulling off the jewelry heist of the century (in...

title: Huang jia shi jie zhi III: Ci xiong da dao

details.title: Star Trek: First Contact
details.plot: The Borg go back in time intent on preventing Earth's first contact with an alien species. Captain Picard and his crew pursue them to ensure that Zefram Cochrane makes his maiden flight reaching warp speed.

tomato.consensus: While fans of the series will surely appreciate it, First Contact is exciting, engaging, and visually appealing enough to entertain Star Trek novices.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 8 wins & 19 nominations.

details.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
details.plot: When Prince John and the Norman Lords begin oppressing the Saxon masses in King Richard's absence, a Saxon lord fights back as the outlaw leader of a rebel guerrilla army.

tomato.consensus: Errol Flynn thrills as the legendary title character, and the film embodies the type of imaginative family adventure tailor-made for the silver screen.

details.title: The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
details.plot: Adventurer/surgeon/rock musician Buckaroo Banzai and his band of men, the Hong Kong Cavaliers, take on evil alien invaders from the 8th dimension.

title: The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension

details.title: Quiz Show
details.plot: A young lawyer, Richard Goodwin, investigates a potentially fixed game show. Charles Van Doren, a big time show winner, is under Goodwin's investigation.

tomato.consensus: Robert Redford refracts the sociopolitical and moral issues posed by the subject material through a purely entertaining, well-acted lens.

awards.text: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 5 wins & 23 nominations.

details.title: There's No Business Like Show Business
details.plot: Molly and Terry Donahue, plus their three children, are The Five Donahues. Son Tim meets hat-check girl Vicky and the family act begins to fall apart.

title: There's No Business Like Show Business

details.title: Shaun of the Dead
details.plot: A man decides to turn his moribund life around by winning back his ex-girlfriend, reconciling his relationship with his mother, and dealing with an entire community that has returned from the dead to eat the living.

tomato.consensus: Shaun of the Dead cleverly balances scares and witty satire, making for a bloody good zombie movie with loads of wit.

details.title: Planet of the Apes
details.plot: An Air Force astronaut crash lands on a mysterious planet where evolved, talking apes dominate a race of primitive humans.

tomato.consensus: This remake of Planet of the Apes can't compare to the original in some critics' mind, but the striking visuals and B-movie charms may win you over.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 BAFTA Film Awards. Another 10 wins & 23 nominations.

details.title: Planet 51
details.director: Jorge Blanco, Javier Abad, Marcos Martínez
details.plot: An alien civilization is invaded by Astronaut Chuck Baker, who believes that the planet was uninhabited. Wanted by the military, Baker must get back to his ship before it goes into orbit without him.

tomato.consensus: Planet 51 squanders an interesting premise with an overly familiar storyline, stock characters, and humor that alternates between curious and potentially offensive.

details.title: Alien³
details.plot: Ripley continues to be stalked by a savage alien, after her escape pod crashes on a prison planet.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 19 nominations.

details.title: Alien Autopsy
details.plot: Humouristic reconstruction of the 1995 scandal when two British lads were accused of having faked a documentary from the Roswell incident in 1947.

details.title: The Karate Kid
details.plot: Work causes a single mother to move to China with her young son; in his new home, the boy embraces kung fu, taught to him by a master.

tomato.consensus: It may not be as powerful as the 1984 edition, but the 2010 Karate Kid delivers a surprisingly satisfying update on the original.

details.title: My Stepmother Is an Alien
details.plot: An alien is sent on a secret mission to Earth, where she appears as a gorgeous, attractive, and single lady. Her mission is to make contact with a rather nerdy young scientist, who's quite ...

details.title: Anacondas: Trail of Blood
details.plot: A genetically created Anaconda, cut in half, regenerates itself into two aggressive giant snakes, due to the Blood Orchid.

details.title: Santa Fe Trail
details.plot: The story of Jeb Stuart, his romance with Kit Carson Holliday, friendship with George Custer and battles against John Brown in the days leading up to the outbreak of the American Civil War.

details.title: All Quiet on the Western Front
details.plot: A young soldier faces profound disillusionment in the soul-destroying horror of World War I.

awards.text: Won 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 win & 6 nominations.

title: All Quiet on the Western Front

details.title: Western
details.plot: Catalonian Paco is a traveling rep for a shoe manufacturer. When he stops to pick up Russian emigree hitchhiker Nino, Paco soon finds himself on the side of the road with everything stolen ...

details.title: Drugstore Cowboy
details.plot: A pharmacy-robbing dope fiend and his crew pop pills and evade the law.

details.title: Son of a Gun
details.plot: JR busts out of prison with Brendan Lynch, Australia's most notorious criminal, and joins Lynch's gang for a gold heist that soon pits the two men against one another.

tomato.consensus: Gritty, stylish, and smart, Son of a Gun serves up plenty of genre thrills while offering a refreshing change of pace for Ewan McGregor.

details.title: The Naked Gun 2½: The Smell of Fear
details.plot: Lieutenant Drebin discovers that his ex-girlfriend's new beau is involved in a plot to kidnap a scientist who advocates solar energy.

title: The Naked Gun 2½: The Smell of Fear

details.title: Carry on Cowboy
details.plot: Stodge City is in the grip of the Rumpo Kid and his gang. Mistaken identity again takes a hand as a "sanitary engineer" (plumber) by the name of Marshal P. Knutt is mistaken for a law marshal! Being the conscientious sort, Marshal tries to help the town get rid of Rumpo, and a showdown is inevitable. Marshal has two aids - revenge-seeking Annie Oakley and his sanitary expertise...

details.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning
details.plot: On one last road trip before they're sent to serve in Vietnam, two brothers and their girlfriends get into an accident that calls their local sheriff to the scene. Thus begins a terrifying experience where the teens are taken to a secluded house of horrors, where a young, would-be killer is being nurtured.

tomato.consensus: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning is full of blood and gore, but not enough scares or a coherent story to make for a successful horror film.

title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning

details.title: From Dusk Till Dawn 2: Texas Blood Money
details.plot: More people are turned into vampires as they go around spreading their evil satanic hate.

title: From Dusk Till Dawn 2: Texas Blood Money

details.title: The Poseidon Adventure
details.plot: A group of passengers struggle to survive and escape when their ocean liner completely capsizes at sea.

details.title: Dawn of the Dead
details.plot: Following an ever-growing epidemic of zombies that have risen from the dead, two Philadelphia S.W.A.T. team members, a traffic reporter, and his television executive girlfriend seek refuge in a secluded shopping mall.

details.title: Remo Williams: The Adventure Begins
details.plot: An officially "dead" cop is trained to become an extraordinarily unique assassin in service of the US president.

details.title: Wild Hogs
details.plot: A group of suburban biker wannabes looking for adventure hit the open road, but get more than they bargained for when they encounter a New Mexico gang called the Del Fuegos.

tomato.consensus: Wild Hogs is a dreadful combination of fish-out-of-water jokes, slapstick, and lazy stereotypes.

details.title: The Wild Bunch
details.plot: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 5 wins & 4 nominations.

details.title: Above the Law
details.plot: A former Special Operations Vietnam vet works as a Chicago cop and uncovers CIA wrongdoing.

details.title: Trouble Bound
details.plot: Upon getting out of prison, a man who took the rap for some thief buddies gets together with them again, and tells them he's not interested in doing things with them any more. They stick a ...

details.title: Bound
details.plot: The daughter of a wealthy real estate broker falls in love with a younger man, who introduces her to B&D and S&M. Using her newly awakened sexual prowess, she finally takes charge of her own life.

details.title: King of Devil's Island
details.plot: Norwegian winter, early 20th century. On the boys home Bastoy, a new inmate leads the boys to a violent uprising against a brutal regime. How far is he willing to go to attain freedom?

details.title: Spy Kids 2: Island of Lost Dreams
details.plot: The Cortez siblings set out for a mysterious island, where they encounter a genetic scientist and a set of rival spy kids.

tomato.consensus: Though the concept is no longer fresh, Spy Kids 2 is still an agreeable and energetic romp.

title: Spy Kids 2: Island of Lost Dreams

details.title: Murphy's Law
details.plot: An action-packed thriller starring Charles Bronson as Jack Murphy, a cop who is running to stay alive long enough to even the score with his wife's killer.

details.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
details.plot: On a quest to find out what happened to his missing brother, a scientist, his nephew and their mountain guide discover a fantastic and dangerous lost world in the center of the earth.

tomato.consensus: Modern visuals and an old fasioned storyline make this family adventure/comedy a fast-paced, kitschy ride.

title: Journey to the Center of the Earth

details.title: Like Stars on Earth
details.plot: An eight-year-old boy is thought to be lazy and a trouble-maker, until the new art teacher has the patience and compassion to discover the real problem behind his struggles in school.

details.title: The Woman
details.plot: When a successful country lawyer captures and attempts to "civilize" the last remaining member of a violent clan that has roamed the Northeast coast for decades, he puts the lives of his family in jeopardy.

tomato.consensus: Strange, audacious, and aggressive, The Woman is an uneven horror flick that game viewers with a wildly bloody finale.

details.title: Lost Highway
details.plot: After a bizarre encounter at a party, a jazz saxophonist is framed for the murder of his wife and sent to prison, where he inexplicably morphs into a young mechanic and begins leading a new life.

details.title: True Romance
details.plot: Clarence marries hooker Alabama, steals cocaine from her pimp, and tries to sell it in Hollywood, while the owners of the coke try to reclaim it.

tomato.consensus: Fueled by Quentin Tarantino's savvy screenplay and a gallery of oddball performances, Tony Scott's True Romance is a funny and violent action jaunt in the best sense.

details.title: Murphy's Romance
details.plot: Emma is a divorced woman with a teen aged boy who moves into a small town and tries to make a go of a horse ranch. Murphy is the town druggist who steers business her way. Things are going ...

details.title: Little Miss Sunshine
details.plot: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.

tomato.consensus: Little Miss Sunshine succeeds thanks to a strong ensemble cast that includes Greg Kinnear, Steve Carell, Toni Collette, Alan Arkin, and Abigail Breslin, as well as a delightfully funny script.

details.title: Little Fockers
details.plot: Family-patriarch Jack Byrnes wants to appoint a successor. Does his son-in-law, the male nurse Greg Focker have what it takes?

tomato.consensus: As star-studded as it is heartbreakingly lazy, Little Fockers takes the top-grossing trilogy to embarrassing new lows.

details.title: Crazy Heart
details.plot: A faded country music musician is forced to reassess his dysfunctional life during a doomed romance that also inspires him.

tomato.consensus: Thanks to a captivating performance from Jeff Bridges, Crazy Heart transcends its overly familiar origins and finds new meaning in an old story.

details.title: Where the Heart Is
details.plot: A pregnant 17-year-old rebuilds her life after being abandoned by her boyfriend at a Wal-Mart in Sequoyah, Oklahoma.

tomato.consensus: Poor script and messy plot undermines the decent cast.

details.title: The Big Lebowski
details.plot: "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire Lebowski, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

tomato.consensus: Typically stunning visuals and sharp dialogue from the Coen Brothers, brought to life with strong performances from Goodman and Bridges.

details.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
details.plot: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.

tomato.consensus: Though it sometimes feels like a television sitcom, My Big Fat Greek Wedding is good-hearted, lovable, and delightfully eccentric, with a sharp script and lead performance from Nia Vardalos.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 18 wins & 24 nominations.

details.title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
details.plot: A young fugitive prince and princess must stop a villain who unknowingly threatens to destroy the world with a special dagger that enables the magic sand inside to reverse time.

tomato.consensus: It doesn't offer much in the way of substance, but Prince of Persia is a suitably entertaining swashbuckler -- and a substantial improvement over most video game adaptations.

title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

details.title: The Time Traveler's Wife
details.plot: A romantic drama about a Chicago librarian with a gene that causes him to involuntarily time travel, and the complications it creates for his marriage.

tomato.consensus: Though it may satisfy fans of the novel, The Time Traveler's Wife's plot contrivances and illogical narrative hamper its big screen effectiveness.

details.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
details.plot: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing for forty years by Lisbeth Salander, a young computer hacker.

tomato.consensus: Brutal yet captivating, The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo is the result of David Fincher working at his lurid best with total role commitment from star Rooney Mara.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

details.title: The Girl Who Played with Fire
details.plot: As computer hacker Lisbeth and journalist Mikael investigate a sex-trafficking ring, Lisbeth is accused of three murders, causing her to go on the run while Mikael works to clear her name.

tomato.consensus: Noomi Rapace and Michael Nyqvist remain extraordinarily well-suited to their roles, but the second installment in Stieg Larsson's Millennium Trilogy doesn't pack quite as much punch as the first.

title: The Girl Who Played with Fire

details.title: Independence Day
details.plot: The aliens are coming and their goal is to invade and destroy Earth. Fighting superior technology, mankind's best weapon is the will to survive.

tomato.consensus: The plot is thin and so is character development, but as a thrilling, spectacle-filled summer movie, Independence Day delivers.

details.title: Die Another Day
details.plot: James Bond is sent to investigate the connection between a North Korean terrorist and a diamond mogul who is funding the development of an international space weapon.

tomato.consensus: Its action may be bit too over-the-top for some, but Die Another Day is lavishly crafted and succeeds in evoking classic Bond themes from the franchise's earlier installments.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 5 wins & 29 nominations.

details.title: Escape from Planet Earth
details.plot: Astronaut Scorch Supernova finds himself caught in a trap when he responds to an SOS from a notoriously dangerous alien planet.

details.title: The Day After Tomorrow
details.plot: Jack Hall, paleoclimatologist, must make a daring trek across America to reach his son, trapped in the cross-hairs of a sudden international storm which plunges the planet into a new Ice Age.

tomato.consensus: A ludicrous popcorn flick filled with clunky dialogues, but spectacular visuals save it from being a total disaster.

awards.text: Won 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 5 wins & 9 nominations.

details.title: Wayne's World
details.plot: Two slacker friends try to promote their public-access cable show.

tomato.consensus: An oddball comedy that revels in its silliness and memorable catch phrases, Wayne's World is also fondly regarded because of its endearing characters.

details.title: Date Night
details.plot: In New York City, a case of mistaken identity turns a bored married couple's attempt at a glamorous and romantic evening into something more thrilling and dangerous.

tomato.consensus: An uneasy blend of action and comedy, Date Night doesn't quite live up to the talents of its two leads, but Steve Carell and Tina Fey still manage to shine through most of the movie's flaws.

details.title: Iron Man 2
details.plot: With the world now aware of his identity as Iron Man, Tony Stark must contend with both his declining health and a vengeful mad man with ties to his father's legacy.

tomato.consensus: It isn't quite the breath of fresh air that Iron Man was, but this sequel comes close with solid performances and an action-packed plot.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 40 nominations.

details.title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
details.plot: When New York is put under siege by Oscorp, it is up to Spider-Man to save the city he swore to protect as well as his loved ones.

tomato.consensus: While the cast is outstanding and the special effects are top-notch, the latest installment of the Spidey saga suffers from an unfocused narrative and an overabundance of characters.

details.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
details.plot: A group of misfits enter a Las Vegas dodgeball tournament in order to save their cherished local gym from the onslaught of a corporate health fitness chain.

tomato.consensus: Proudly profane and splendidly silly, Dodgeball is a worthy spiritual successor to the goofball comedies of the 1980s.

details.title: A Christmas Story
details.plot: Ralphie has to convince his parents, his teacher, and Santa that a Red Ryder B.B. gun really is the perfect gift for the 1940s.

tomato.consensus: Both warmly nostalgic and darkly humorous, A Christmas Story deserves its status as a holiday perennial.

details.title: A Bug's Life
details.plot: A misfit ant, looking for "warriors" to save his colony from greedy grasshoppers, recruits a group of bugs that turn out to be an inept circus troupe.

tomato.consensus: A Bug's Life is a rousing adventure that blends animated thrills with witty dialogue and memorable characters - and another smashing early success for Pixar.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 14 wins & 19 nominations.

title: Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb

tomato.consensus: A poorly constructed, derivative sci-fi stinker with a weak script and poor action sequences.

details.plot: An ambitious but troubled movie director tries his best to fulfill his dream, despite his lack of support.

tomato.consensus: Tim Burton and Johnny Depp team up to fete the life and work of cult hero Ed Wood, with typically strange and wonderful results.

details.title: As Good as It Gets
details.plot: A single mother/waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is in an accident.

tomato.consensus: James L. Brooks and Jack Nicholson, doing what they do best, combine smart dialogue and flawless acting to squeeze fresh entertainment value out of the romantic-comedy genre.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 14 wins & 3 nominations.
